subject: chemistry
title: Factors Affecting Equilibrium Position MCQ Problems

problems.question:
Which of these factors do affect equilibrium position?

Pressure
Temperature
Concentration
Catalysts
problems.hint: Think about what factors affect it.
problems.detailed: The only factor here that does not directly affect the equilibrium position is catalysts. Pressure, concentration, and temperature directly influence the final concentrations of products and reactants.
problems.author: Jailson Godeiro

problems.question: What happens to the equilibrium position of a reaction if the temperature increases?
options: It is shifted towards the reactants
It is shifted towards the products
It is not affected by temperature
It will depend whether the reaction is endothermic or exothermic
problems.hint: Remember how temperature affects the equilibrium position.
problems.detailed: It depends whether the reaction is endothermic \((\Delta H>0)\) or exothermic \((\Delta H<0)\). If endothermic, the equilibrium shifts toward the products. If exothermic, it shifts toward the reactants.
problems.author: Jailson Godeiro

problems.question:
Consider the reaction:

\[\ce{H2 + Cl2 -> 2 HCl}\]

What happens if more \(\ce{H2}\) is added?
problems.hint: Remember how concentration affects equilibrium position.
problems.detailed: Increasing the concentration of \(\ce{H2}\) shifts the equilibrium toward the products. Therefore, the concentration of \(\ce{HCl}\) increases.
problems.author: Jailson Godeiro

problems.question:
Consider the reaction:

\[\ce{2 H2(g) + O2(g) -> 2 H2O(g)}\]

What will change if the pressure of the system decreases?
problems.hint: Remember how pressure affects equilibrium position.
problems.detailed: Decreasing the pressure shifts the equilibrium to the side with more moles of gas. Reactants have 3 moles (2 \(\ce{H2}\) + 1 \(\ce{O2}\)) and products have 2 moles (2 \(\ce{H2O}\)). Therefore, the concentration of \(\ce{H2}\) increases.
problems.author: Jailson Godeiro

problems.question: Which of these statements about catalysts is correct?
options: It speeds up the rate of the forward reaction, but slows down the reverse one
It does affect the position of equilibrium
It can shift the equilibrium depending on concentrations
problems.hint: Remember the role of catalysts in a chemical reaction.
problems.detailed: Catalysts speed up both the forward and reverse reactions equally, so they do not affect equilibrium position. They only influence the reaction rate. Therefore, the correct answer is B.
problems.author: Jailson Godeiro
